summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 14, 2019. It includes inmate count sheets, out-count forms, and inmate rosters, which are standard prison operational records for tracking inmate location and assignments. The significance lies in the date, as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody at this facility, though his name is not listed in these specific pages.

events.title: Daily Prison Administrative Counts
events.description: Routine inmate counts and out-counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, as documented by various Bureau of Prisons forms.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The documents are dated August 14, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
These are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms, including count sheets, out-count forms, and inmate rosters, used for tracking inmate location and assignments.
Jeffrey Epstein's name does not appear in these specific pages, which list other inmates present in the facility on that date.
The documents show the routine operational procedures of the MCC, including housing unit assignments and special designations like 'SUICIDE OR' (likely Suicide Observation) for some inmates.
One inmate, CHAN, is listed on a hospital roster, indicating some inmates were in medical units during the counts.
